doc.title: Inside 'The Cup'
doc.plot: Inside The Cup Khyentse Norbu on Cinema Khyentse Norbu is a renowned Tibetan Buddhist teacher. He also makes movies. His first two films, The Cup and Travellers & Magicians, were critical and box office successes. Inside The Cup explores the making of his first feature, about soccer-obsessed Tibetan monks, and offers a provocative case for a Buddhist philosophy of "life as cinema." Written and directed by Isaiah Seret (adapted from Life As Cinema, by Anika Tokarchuk)/2007/USA/22 minutes/color
